'Glyceraldehyde' is a triose monosaccharide with chemical formula
C 3H 6O 3. It is the simplest of all common
aldoses. It is a sweet, colorless, crystalline solid that is an intermediate
compound in carbohydrate metabolism. The word comes from combining glycerine and
aldehyde, as glyceraldehyde is merely glycerine with one hydroxymethylene group
changed to an aldehyde.
